title: US "Absolutely" Ready For First Woman President: Kamala Harris
content: Kamala Harris said Tuesday that America is "absolutely" ready to elect its first woman president but downplayed her historic bid, saying she simply wants to turn the page for a nation "exhausted" by Donald Trump.
summary: Kamala Harris said Tuesday that America is "absolutely" ready to elect its first woman president but downplayed her historic bid, saying she simply wants to turn the page for a nation "exhausted" by Donald Trump.

title: Prime Minister Modi To Meet China's Xi In Russia
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping will hold their first bilateral meeting in five years Wednesday, Indian officials said, days after their countries reached a deal on their contested border.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping will hold their first bilateral meeting in five years Wednesday, Indian officials said, days after their countries reached a deal on their contested border.

title: Donald Trump Enters World's 500 Richest List For First Time In 11 Weeks
content: Donald Trump has rejoined the Bloomberg Billionaires Index for the first time since Aug. 6 as his media startup's stock surges alongside his odds in political betting markets.
summary: Donald Trump has rejoined the Bloomberg Billionaires Index for the first time since Aug. 6 as his media startup's stock surges alongside his odds in political betting markets.

title: Ex Abercrombie CEO, Partner Accused Of Sex-Trafficking Involving Make Models
content: Former Abercrombie & Fitch Chief Executive Officer Mike Jeffries was charged by the US with running a sex-trafficking ring that coerced young men to engage in sexual acts with him in hopes of a career in modeling.
summary: Former Abercrombie & Fitch Chief Executive Officer Mike Jeffries was charged by the US with running a sex-trafficking ring that coerced young men to engage in sexual acts with him in hopes of a career in modeling.

title: Marriage Apps In Pakistan, Claiming To Be 'Halal', Rival "Rishta Aunties"
content: Marriage apps describe themselves as "halal", or permissible in Islam, offering options to blur profile pictures for privacy and making clear the purpose is to reach a proposal.
summary: Marriage apps describe themselves as "halal", or permissible in Islam, offering options to blur profile pictures for privacy and making clear the purpose is to reach a proposal.

title: Is Scurvy Making A Comeback? What Is It? All You Need To Know
content: Scurvy is a disease caused by a severe deficiency of vitamin C (ascorbic acid), which is essential for the production of collagen. This protein helps maintain the health of skin, blood vessels, bones and connective tissue.
summary: Scurvy is a disease caused by a severe deficiency of vitamin C (ascorbic acid), which is essential for the production of collagen. This protein helps maintain the health of skin, blood vessels, bones and connective tissue.

title: Another Satellite Breakup Adds To More Than 4,300 Tonnes Of Space Junk
content: The European Space Agency estimates there are more than 40,000 pieces larger than 10cm in orbit, and more than 130,000,000 smaller than 1cm.
summary: The European Space Agency estimates there are more than 40,000 pieces larger than 10cm in orbit, and more than 130,000,000 smaller than 1cm.

title: What's Is E. Coli Outbreak That's Being Linked To McDonald's Burgers
content: A person died and 49 others fell ill following an E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers, according to a report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
summary: A person died and 49 others fell ill following an E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers, according to a report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

title: How McDonald's Responded To Bacterial Outbreak Linked To Its Burgers
content: One person died and 10 others fell sick following a severe E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers.
summary: One person died and 10 others fell sick following a severe E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers.

title: What Is Pink Cocaine? The "Unpredictable" Drug Linked To Liam Payne's Death
content: Pink cocaine, a highly potent and unpredictable designer drug, is a powdery mixture of various psychoactive substances.
summary: Pink cocaine, a highly potent and unpredictable designer drug, is a powdery mixture of various psychoactive substances.

title: Climate Change Worsened Deadly Africa Floods: Study
content: Human-caused climate change worsened floods that have killed hundreds of people and displaced millions in Cameroon, Chad, Niger, Nigeria and Sudan this year, according to a study published on Wednesday.
summary: Human-caused climate change worsened floods that have killed hundreds of people and displaced millions in Cameroon, Chad, Niger, Nigeria and Sudan this year, according to a study published on Wednesday.

title: Britain's King Charles To Be Offered High Chief Title In Samoa
content: Britain's King Charles will be offered the title of high chief in Samoa in a three-day visit starting Wednesday and will be shown the impact of rising sea levels due to climate change in the Pacific island nation.
summary: Britain's King Charles will be offered the title of high chief in Samoa in a three-day visit starting Wednesday and will be shown the impact of rising sea levels due to climate change in the Pacific island nation.

title: Adult Film Stars Launch 'Hands Off My Porn' Campaign Against Donald Trump
content: The '#HandsOffMyPorn' campaign is warning viewers that prominent allies of Donald Trump want to ban pornography and lock up the stars who bring it to vivid, graphic life.
summary: The '#HandsOffMyPorn' campaign is warning viewers that prominent allies of Donald Trump want to ban pornography and lock up the stars who bring it to vivid, graphic life.

title: Japan Makes Tepid Push On Gender Gap In Politics As Election Nears
content: Karen Makishima is the only female running for Japan's ruling party in her 20-seat prefecture for the October 27 general election, reflecting the tough battle women face in breaking into the country's male dominated politics.
summary: Karen Makishima is the only female running for Japan's ruling party in her 20-seat prefecture for the October 27 general election, reflecting the tough battle women face in breaking into the country's male dominated politics.

title: "Defenders Need Us": Ukraine Cafe Gives Glimpse Of Normalcy Amid Raging War
content: Russian troops are barely 10 kilometres from the city but in the cafe, the sounds of war are drowned out by the whir of the coffee machine.
summary: Russian troops are barely 10 kilometres from the city but in the cafe, the sounds of war are drowned out by the whir of the coffee machine.

title: Bill Gates Backs Harris With $50 Million Donation, "Concerned" Over Trump
content: Billionaire and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has recently donated about $50 million to a nonprofit organization supporting Kamala Harris' US presidential run, the New York Times reported Tuesday.
summary: Billionaire and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has recently donated about $50 million to a nonprofit organization supporting Kamala Harris' US presidential run, the New York Times reported Tuesday.

title: Chinese Warships Sailing Toward Sensitive Strait Amid Tensions: Taiwan
content: Taipei said Wednesday it had detected a Chinese aircraft carrier group sailing towards waters separating Taiwan and China, a day after Beijing held a live-fire exercise near the self-ruled island.
summary: Taipei said Wednesday it had detected a Chinese aircraft carrier group sailing towards waters separating Taiwan and China, a day after Beijing held a live-fire exercise near the self-ruled island.

title: Israel Confirms Killing Successor Of Hezbollah Chief Hassan Nasrallah
content: Israel's army confirmed Tuesday it "eliminated" Hezbollah's Hashem Safieddine, apparent successor of slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, in a strike in a southern Beirut suburb three weeks ago.
summary: Israel's army confirmed Tuesday it "eliminated" Hezbollah's Hashem Safieddine, apparent successor of slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, in a strike in a southern Beirut suburb three weeks ago.

title: McDonald's Linked To One Death, Dozens Of Food Poisonings In US
content: One person has died and dozens have fallen sick following a severe E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said Tuesday.
summary: One person has died and dozens have fallen sick following a severe E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder hamburgers, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said Tuesday.

title: "Huge Opportunity For...": Former NITI Aayog CEO On 'The India Century'
content: India's G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant today spoke at the NDTV World Summit in Delhi where he mentioned that this will be "India's century".
summary: India's G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant today spoke at the NDTV World Summit in Delhi where he mentioned that this will be "India's century".
